column5: I am going to ottawa next weekend and I am looking for some information on some possible locations to take my friend. I remember a couple years ago we were walking up the rideau but I don't know if there would be enough ice on there yet. Thanks guys
if you are looking to rent, Oziles in the east end Orleans is great i hear. If you want to be outside on the ice, try Shirleys Bay in the west end,out in Kanata.

I live on the other side of the Ottawa and both Ottawa R & Gatineau R are open water in the middle..... I can't speak for the Rideau R but would imagine some parts being open.... Sorry can't help you there  Only thing frozen is the back bays and lakes but I'd be extra careful. Leechman
wow !! that must be a first Jacques.Guess the mild weather must be really messing things up for ice fishing.
I kinda figured we will have to leave the city..ill have to look online for some bait shops in ottawa and give them a call

Shirley's Bay is Producing some walleye and Crappie of late..and there are a couple of huts out on 8 to 10 inches of ice   When you get to Ottawa .......pm me and i'll give you more details on some other spots
Thanks a lot I'm happy with those conditions.. Wish I knew what part of ottawa I'm going to, is shirleys bay a far drive from around carelton university?
Perfect .. I will definitely pm u later on. Thanks a lot!
I guess my last question is what is the name for a bait shop in that area?
Yeah Paul before New Year, it was frozen but the mild temp put a damper on it for sure     but I'm not targeting the river
But i'll look in to it
Not to infringe on this board,but you could check out fish-hawk.net which is an Ottawa area fishing board. There is some info on there.
You could also cast open water right at Carleton Jason.. under the Bronson St Bridge.. there's eyes in there..
Well leaving tonight and fishing tomorrow. Any last minute ideas or things I should know?  Thanks
